headliner 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Compare two conditions within a data frame

Source: R/compare-conditions.R
compare_conditions.Rd

Compare two conditions within a data frame

compare_conditions(
  df,
  compare,
  reference,
  cols = everything(),
  calc = list(mean = mean)
)

Arguments

df

data frame
compare

condition for comparison, same criteria you would use in 'dplyr::filter'
reference

same as compare
cols

columns to use in comparison
calc

named list of the functions to use, ex: list(mean = mean, sd = sd) 'purrr' style phrases are also supported like list(mean = ~mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE), sd = sd)

Examples

flights_jfk %>%
  compare_conditions(
    compare = (carrier == "AA"),
    reference = complete.cases(.),
    c(dep_delay, arr_delay),
    calc = list(mean = mean, sd = sd)
  ) %>%
  view_list()

#>                         VALUES
#> mean_arr_delay_comp  3.5536618
#> mean_arr_delay_ref   0.1459121
#> mean_dep_delay_comp 13.4071904
#> mean_dep_delay_ref  10.4112821
#> sd_arr_delay_comp   53.3677492
#> sd_arr_delay_ref    44.0386496
#> sd_dep_delay_comp   47.9725670
#> sd_dep_delay_ref    37.7792880

mtcars %>%
  compare_conditions(
    compare = (hp > 100 | gear == 4),
    reference = (mpg > 24),
    dplyr::starts_with("d"),
    calc = list(mean = mean, max = max)
  ) %>%
  view_list()

#>                    VALUES
#> max_disp_comp  472.000000
#> max_disp_ref   146.700000
#> max_drat_comp    4.930000
#> max_drat_ref     4.930000
#> mean_disp_comp 238.090000
#> mean_disp_ref   95.228571
#> mean_drat_comp   3.565333
#> mean_drat_ref    4.171429
